page.title: 06COASTLINE PUCKPOOL-SEAVIEW
page.content: From Puckpool Point the{shore}changes. There is a bank of stones on the upper shore with seaweed covered stones and rocks scattered over the middle and lower shore. 3{seaforts}can be seen. These were built in the 1850's as a defence against Napoleon. Inland is a silted up estuary called{The Duver.} Originally a busy harbour, it was then used for salt manufacture. It is now an area of marshy pasture with lake, dykes and a reedbed - a valuable area for wildlife. The Duver Road ls a privately owned{toll road.}It is a popular launching site for{windsurfers at high tide. People living in the{ {Salterns Cottages,}at the end of the toll road, have the worry of being flooded by Spring tides. From this point there is a{winding footpath} on the sea wall leading to Seaview.
